title: Art Of Noise - And What Have You Done With My Body, God [FLAC+MP
description:
Art Of Noise - And What Have You Done With My Body, God? [2006] [EAC-FLAC+MP3]
 <a href="
http://imgchicken.com/images/70685860743613812468.png" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW">
http://imgchicken.com/images/70685860743613812468.png</a>

album review from


And What Have You Done With My Body God? is a very comprehensive look at Art Of Noise in their infancy. 
It covers the two years that they were on ZTT, the label that gave them life, and fans are able to hear 
rough mixes, demos, outtakes, and what were assumed to be discarded masters. Those who were impacted by 
the influence of their "Into Battle" EP and the "(Who's Afraid Of) The Art Of Noise" album will enjoy 
hearing the development of such songs as "Beat Box", "Close (To The Edit)", "Moments In Love", 
"A Time For Fear (Who's Afraid)", and "Snapshot".

The booklet features interviews with all five original members (Trevor Horn, Anne Dudley, Jonathan "J.J." 
Jeczalik, Gary Langan, and Paul Morley) talking about their music, their goals, and their anti-image, 
since in the early days they were represented with masks, statues, and wrenches. The reasons as to why 
are touched upon here. Also touched upon are the reasons as to why the core of the group left their 
label in order to find recognition and perhaps hit songs. They were able to find both, a
nd not always with good results.

"And What Have You Done With My Body God" features over 40 unreleased tracks on three CD's. The fourth 
CD features the complete "Into Battle" EP (although the mix for "Moments In Love" is the single edit, 
not the full length version), along with the programs originally released on the cassingles for 
"Close (To The Edit)" and "Moments In Love". Beat junkies, cratediggers, and bedroom producers will 
also love the insight of some of the secrets revealed within the AoN empire. An appropriate box set 
from one of the best "non-groups" in the world.
